details.name: Reducing anxiety towards other dogs
details.description: Through your descriptions and my observations of your dog, I have deduced that your dog has anxiety-related issues with other dogs.

interventions.name: Tell-training
interventions.description: On at least one of your daily walks, I want you to bring high-value treats and use them generously when you or CuteDog spots another dog.

metrics.name: Encounters
metrics.description: Count the amount of encounters on your walk

metrics.name: Reaction
metrics.description: Did he react by barking/lunging/pulling towards the trigger?

interventions.name: Sniffaries
interventions.description: At least a few times a week, go for  sniffary in a natural environment such as the beach or the woods, where you won't meet as many dogs. Let CuteDog sniff his way through the place - reinforce the behavior by occasionally dropping treats on the ground.

metrics.name: Rate the sniffary
metrics.description: How was your experience with the walk - one star is bad, five is exellent.

metrics.name: How long was the sniffary?
metrics.description: From you let CuteDog start sniffing, how long did he get to sniff?

details.name: Improving calm behavior when home alone
details.description: Based on your reports and my assessment, your dog shows signs of stress and frustration when left alone. This plan focuses on increasing comfort, predictability, and relaxation during alone-time.

interventions.name: Graduated alone-time training
interventions.description: Practice leaving your dog alone for very short periods and gradually increase the duration. Start with seconds and build up slowly, ensuring your dog remains calm at each step.

metrics.name: Duration alone
metrics.description: How long was your dog left alone during this session?

metrics.name: Calm behavior
metrics.description: Did your dog remain calm while you were away?

interventions.name: Pre-departure enrichment
interventions.description: Before leaving the house, provide a long-lasting enrichment activity such as a stuffed Kong or lick mat to help your dog associate departures with positive experiences.

metrics.name: Engagement level
metrics.description: How engaged was your dog with the enrichment item?

metrics.name: Sessions completed
metrics.description: How many times did you provide enrichment before leaving?

details.name: Reducing leash pulling on walks
details.description: Your dog tends to pull strongly on the leash, especially in stimulating environments. This plan focuses on reinforcing loose-leash walking and reducing frustration.

interventions.name: Loose leash reinforcement
interventions.description: Reward your dog frequently when the leash is slack. Stop moving forward if tension appears, and resume once the leash loosens.

metrics.name: Pulling incidents
metrics.description: How many times did your dog pull during the walk?

metrics.name: Walk duration
metrics.description: How long was the walk?

details.name: Reducing excessive barking at visitors
details.description: Your dog becomes vocal and over-aroused when visitors enter the home. This plan aims to build calm alternative behaviors.

interventions.name: Settle on mat
interventions.description: Train your dog to go to a designated mat when the doorbell rings. Reinforce calm behavior generously.

metrics.name: Settled on mat
metrics.description: Did your dog settle on the mat when the visitor arrived?

metrics.name: Calmness rating
metrics.description: Rate your dog’s calmness during the visit.

details.name: Improving recall reliability
details.description: Your dog struggles to return when called in distracting environments. This plan focuses on building a strong positive recall.

interventions.name: High-value recall games
interventions.description: Practice recall using high-value rewards in low-distraction areas before gradually increasing difficulty.

metrics.name: Successful recalls
metrics.description: How many successful recalls occurred?

metrics.name: Recall attempts
metrics.description: How many recall attempts were made?

interventions.name: Loose leash reinforcement
interventions.description: Reward your dog frequently when the leash is slack. Stop moving forward if tension appears, and resume once the leash loosens.

metrics.name: Pulling incidents
metrics.description: How many times did your dog pull during the walk?

metrics.name: Walk duration
metrics.description: How long was the walk?

metrics.name: Stress level
metrics.description: Rate your dog’s stress level during the exercise.

details.name: Reducing food guarding behavior
details.description: Your dog shows signs of stress when approached during meals. This plan focuses on desensitization and trust-building.

interventions.name: Food bowl approach exercises
interventions.description: Gradually approach your dog during meals and toss higher-value food to create positive associations.

metrics.name: Relaxed response
metrics.description: Did your dog remain relaxed during the approach?

metrics.name: Stress level
metrics.description: Rate your dog’s stress level during the exercise.

details.name: Building confidence in new environments
details.description: Your dog appears hesitant and cautious in unfamiliar places. This plan focuses on gradual exposure and confidence-building.

interventions.name: Controlled exploration walks
interventions.description: Visit new environments briefly and allow your dog to explore at their own pace while reinforcing curiosity.

metrics.name: Exploration time
metrics.description: How long did your dog explore the new environment?

metrics.name: Confidence rating
metrics.description: Rate your dog’s confidence level during the outing.

metrics.name: Relaxed response
metrics.description: Did your dog remain relaxed during the approach?

metrics.name: Recall attempts
metrics.description: How many recall attempts were made?
